Namespace.LogExports.description: The types of logs the namespace can export. Available export types are `User log` , `Connection log` , and `User activity log` .

Namespace.NamespaceName.description: The name of the namespace. Must be between 3-64 alphanumeric characters in lowercase, and it cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found in [Reserved Words](https://docs.aws.amazon.com//redshift/latest/dg/r_pg_keywords.html) in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

Namespace.CreationDate.description: The date of when the namespace was created.

Namespace.AdminUsername.description: The username of the administrator for the first database created in the namespace.

Namespace.KmsKeyId.description: The ID of the AWS Key Management Service key used to encrypt your data.

Namespace.DbName.description: The name of the first database created in the namespace.

Namespace.IamRoles.description: A list of IAM roles to associate with the namespace.

Namespace.NamespaceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with a namespace.

Namespace.NamespaceId.description: The unique identifier of a namespace.

Namespace.DefaultIamRoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to set as a default in the namespace.

AdminPasswordSecretArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the namespace's admin user credentials secret.

AdminPasswordSecretKmsKeyId.description: The ID of the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt and store the namespace's admin credentials secret.

AdminUsername.description: The username of the administrator for the first database created in the namespace.

CreationDate.description: The date of when the namespace was created.

DbName.description: The name of the first database created in the namespace.

DefaultIamRoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to set as a default in the namespace.

IamRoles.description: A list of IAM roles to associate with the namespace.

KmsKeyId.description: The ID of the AWS Key Management Service key used to encrypt your data.

LogExports.description: The types of logs the namespace can export. Available export types are User log, Connection log, and User activity log.

NamespaceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with a namespace.

NamespaceId.description: The unique identifier of a namespace.

NamespaceName.description: The name of the namespace. Must be between 3-64 alphanumeric characters in lowercase, and it cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found in [Reserved Words](https://docs.aws.amazon.com//redshift/latest/dg/r_pg_keywords.html) in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

Namespace.description: A collection of database objects and users.

DestinationKmsKeyId.description: The ID of the KMS key to use to encrypt your snapshots in the destination AWS Region .

DestinationRegion.description: The destination AWS Region to copy snapshots to.

SnapshotRetentionPeriod.description: The retention period of snapshots that are copied to the destination AWS Region .

SnapshotCopyConfiguration.description: The object that you configure to copy snapshots from one namespace to a namespace in another AWS Region .

description: A collection of database objects and users.

AdminPasswordSecretKmsKeyId.description: The ID of the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt and store the namespace's admin credentials secret. You can only use this parameter if `ManageAdminPassword` is `true` .

AdminUserPassword.description: The password of the administrator for the primary database created in the namespace.

AdminUsername.description: The username of the administrator for the primary database created in the namespace.

DbName.description: The name of the primary database created in the namespace.

DefaultIamRoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to set as a default in the namespace.

FinalSnapshotName.description: The name of the snapshot to be created before the namespace is deleted.

FinalSnapshotRetentionPeriod.description: How long to retain the final snapshot.

IamRoles.description: A list of IAM roles to associate with the namespace.

KmsKeyId.description: The ID of the AWS Key Management Service key used to encrypt your data.

LogExports.description: The types of logs the namespace can export. Available export types are `userlog` , `connectionlog` , and `useractivitylog` .

ManageAdminPassword.description: If true, Amazon Redshift uses AWS Secrets Manager to manage the namespace's admin credentials. You can't use `AdminUserPassword` if `ManageAdminPassword` is true. If `ManageAdminPassword` is `false` or not set, Amazon Redshift uses `AdminUserPassword` for the admin user account's password.

NamespaceName.description: The name of the namespace. Must be between 3-64 alphanumeric characters in lowercase, and it cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found in [Reserved Words](https://docs.aws.amazon.com//redshift/latest/dg/r_pg_keywords.html) in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

NamespaceResourcePolicy.description: The resource policy that will be attached to the namespace.

RedshiftIdcApplicationArn.description: The ARN for the Redshift application that integrates with IAM Identity Center.

SnapshotCopyConfigurations.description: The snapshot copy configurations for the namespace.

Tags.description: The map of the key-value pairs used to tag the namespace.
